notes: Issuer-controlled freeze of 5 TRON wallets linked to PDVSA. Largest single-day USDT freeze.
Isolated Recovery approach: validators halted network, restricted only affected accounts. CGC authorized burns. 87.96B FLOW duplicated (~7B nominal), 99.25% recovered.
Governance-approved hard fork ~30 days after initial exploit. Soft fork froze funds, hard fork redistributed $9.4M. Monerium/Stakewise protected €3M+.
Validators coordinated 30-hour network halt. White-hat cooperation recovered all $12.8M+ via pre-signed transactions. Emergency hard-fork executed.

Sonic Labs deployed freezeAccount (commit b584c86) ~2hrs after exploit. Beets affected pools: stS/S, wOS/S. Freeze was effective for native $S tokens (21.5% of total value), but permit bypass allowed moving stS tokens. Total value at risk: $4.07M. $3.2M lost, $0.87M frozen.
$94.8M exploit via CSP rounding bug. Hypernative detected at 07:52 UTC; CSPv6 paused at 08:07 UTC ($19.3M protected). StakeWise recovered $21.8M, whitehats $4.6M. Total $45.7M protected/recovered.
Pause guardian multisig halted all markets during ADA flash crash; kill switch exists separately.
~$223M stolen. Validators froze 2 attacker addresses; 90.9% stake vote authorized recovery into recovery multisig.

Uniswap v4 hook exploit. Hypernative alerted at 11:43 UTC (4 min after exploit). War room with Spearbit, Quantstamp, Certora. All contracts paused by 12:33 UTC. ~$20M in other vaults protected (est.).

$4.75M exploit via claimRewards() vulnerability. Attack began 07:35 UTC, war room assembled by 07:50 UTC. Protocol paused within 10 minutes. Attackers mimicked LFJ contracts to bypass solvency checks. rTKN reimbursement plan implemented for users.

$50M exploit via compromised developer devices (3 hardware wallets). Attack began 15:46 UTC, detected immediately. Protocol paused across all chains by 17:40 UTC. Sophisticated attack bypassed front-end verification in Safe{Wallet}. Compromised signers removed from multisig by 22:10 UTC.

$20M donation attack on newly deployed VELO markets. Attack executed after 2-day timelock expired. Whitehat saved $6.5M by front-running with $100 VELO. Team detected incident 25 minutes after exploit, paused all Optimism markets within 30 minutes.

Private key compromise via phishing led to unauthorized minting of 1.79B PLA ($290M) across two attacks (Feb 9 10:39 PM and Feb 12 10:09 PM UTC+9). Team failed to detect first attack until second attack occurred 72 hours later. Hacker paused contract on Feb 13 11:05 AM UTC+9 (85 hours after first attack). Only $32M was liquidated before exchanges froze deposits. Migration to PDA with KYC/AML checks implemented.

Emergency multisig (7 members) executed 90-minute recovery operation after Balancer V2 exploit. Burned 5,041 osETH ($19M) and 13,495 osGNO ($1.7M) from attacker, re-minted to DAO. 75% of stolen osTokens recovered. Followed by SWIP-37 to renounce contract ownership.

Coordinated attack across SUSHI and YFI markets. Attacker used 100+ wallets to build leveraged long positions, manipulated spot prices, and withdrew profits. dYdX responded within 2 days with: 1) 100% margin requirements, 2) Reduced position sizes, 3) Enhanced monitoring. $9M insurance fund loss. Incident led to improved risk controls and automatic margin adjustments in dYdX v4.

Vyper compiler bug (v0.2.15-0.3.0) caused reentrancy guard failure. 4 distinct exploits: pETH/ETH ($11M), msETH/ETH ($3.4M), alETH/ETH ($22.6M), CRV/ETH ($19.3M). Whitehat recovered $5.4M from CRV/ETH pool. Emergency subDAO killed gauge emissions. Bug patched in v0.3.1.

Emergency governance response to USDC depeg. Vote 1 (Mar 11): Passed 16:14 UTC, executed Mar 13 16:16 UTC - reduced vault ceilings, increased PSM-USDP to 1B DAI, raised USDC fees to 1%, reduced GSM delay to 16hrs. Vote 2 (Mar 14): Passed Mar 15 18:18 UTC, executed Mar 16 10:20 UTC - added Debt Ceiling Breaker for instant vault pauses. 120-minute total response time.

Guardian paused CRV market borrowing during Curve exploit concern. Module-level pause. Timeline: Nov 22 08:12 UTC - Large CRV borrowing triggered price drop to $0.4096; 10:35 UTC - Price hit lowest; 11:00 UTC - Market rebounded; 13:31 UTC - First liquidation. $1.7M bad debt left on protocol. Multiple AIPs executed to manage CRV risk (AIP-121/124 freeze, AIP-125/126 unfreeze, AIP-286 LTV→0, AIP-288 LT/LTV reductions).

BSC Token Hub bridge exploit via forged proof verification bug. 2M BNB ($570M) minted and taken. Validators coordinated 5-hour synchronized pause/resume (not rollback) among 26+ validators including CoinbaseCloud, Figment, and 24 others. $470M secured in exploiter's address, $100M moved off-chain. No users affected. First pause in BSC history.

Centre consortium (Circle + Coinbase) blacklisted Tornado Cash wallets following OFAC sanctions. 75,000 USDC frozen across sanctioned addresses including Tornado Cash's USDC pool. Blacklist function 'blacklist(address investor)' blocks transfers from sanctioned addresses. Circle confirmed compliance with OFAC requirements. Previous similar action: $100k frozen in July 2020.

Sky Mavis validator nodes compromised via spear-phishing. Attacker gained 5/9 validator keys (4 Sky Mavis + 1 Axie DAO) by exploiting gas-free RPC access. 173,600 ETH + 25.5M USDC ($625M total) drained in two transactions. Discovered 6 days later (Mar 29). $187.5M recovered via law enforcement/FBI action against North Korean Lazarus Group. Security upgrades: increased validators to 11+, targeting 21+, zero-trust model, $1M bug bounty.

Horizon bridge compromised via phishing attack on 2-of-5 multi-signature wallet. Attackers gained internal server access, installed trojan on employee laptop, obtained private keys and non-public bridge code. $99.6M stolen, consolidated to ETH, laundered through Tornado Cash/Railgun. Harmony offered $10M bounty (increased from $1M), no recovery. Subsequent Trustless BTC bridge pause to protect users.

ERC-1155 reentrancy exploit via depositAdditionalToFNFT flaw. Attacker created FNFTs with zero depositAmount, exploited timing bug to overwrite configs, stole $2M tokens (BLOCKS, ECO, RENA). Team alerted at 2:24 UTC, soft-locked contracts across chains by 3:58 UTC. RVST token transfer pause at 3:13 UTC prevented additional $1.15M loss from RVST-ETH pool. V2 contract migration planned.

Portal bridge exploit; Jump Crypto replenished 120,000 ETH ($325M) immediately. One year later (Feb 21, 2023), Jump Crypto executed counter-exploit via Oasis Multisig to recover $218M collateral ($140M net after DAI repayment). Court-authorized recovery through upgradable Oasis contract vulnerability.

Front-end compromise via Cloudflare API key breach. Attacker injected malicious script into BadgerDAO website, tricking users into approving malicious transactions. 900 BTC ($50.8M) stolen from single user, total $120.3M across multiple users. Protocol paused all smart contracts to prevent further withdrawals. Most users interact via front-end rather than direct contract calls.

Complex flash loan exploit targeting price calculation of wrappable tokens. Attacker used two addresses to manipulate yUSDVault share price via $500M deposits, borrowed against inflated collateral. Stole $136M, protocol paused v1 markets and disabled wrappable token supply/borrow. Yearn recovered $9.42M 'donated' to yUSD vault during attack. Third exploit for C.R.E.A.M. in 2021.

Cross-chain bridge exploit via verifyHeaderAndExecuteTx vulnerability. Attacker 'Mr. White Hat' (pseudonym) specified own contract as trusted partner, stole $611M across Ethereum/BSC/Polygon. $33M in USDT frozen by Tether. Recovery via on-chain negotiation, community pressure, and attacker cooperation. Attacker returned $578M and released access to multisig wallet holding remaining funds by Aug 11. Donated $525,000 to community, later returned to Poly Network.

$30.95M USDT stolen from treasury wallet on Nov 19, 2017 via unauthorized transfer to Bitcoin address. Tether issued software update to blacklist attacker address and prevent movement of stolen coins. Required all users to install update immediately. Several crypto exchanges froze Tether trading. Linked to Bitfinex hack context.

1.1B VET tokens ($6.5M) stolen from authority masternode account. Community governance vote authorized validator-enforced blocklist of 469 addresses, freezing 727M VET tokens. 373M VET tokens were laundered/unrecoverable.

Funds were returned via a community-authorized hard fork (~31 days after hack). The attacker had to wait 28 days to withdraw due to the DAO contract's lock period; providing time for the fork. This action created the Ethereum Classic chain.
